translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Chapter with Kaṇikāra Flower Similes
the god of gods, the Worthy One,
and I was established in the wholesome;
They held up a parasol in the sky,
this is the fruit of that past deed.
in the Dispensation of the Buddha.
the madness of the parasol I gave then,
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of giving the parasol.
they were rulers of the people;
they were kings who ruled the world.
I have done the Teacher’s work.”🔽Thus the elder Pāpanivāri recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā pāpanivāriyo thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Pāpanivāriyattherassāpadānaṁ dasamaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā pāpanivāriyaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati  pāpanivāriya therassa apadānam dasama
translated: The Elder Pāpanivāri’s Birth Story, the tenth.
The Chapter with Kaṇikāra Flower Similes, the twenty-first.
